snippet: Judge Baltasar Garzón was found to have overstepped his authority in a wiretapping case and ordered suspended from the courts for 11 years.
abstract: Spain’s Supreme Court convicts crusading human rights judge Baltasar Garzon of illegally ordering wiretapping in a corruption case and suspends him from the courts for 11 years; ruling comes in one of three cases against Garzon, who has made aggressive use of the doctrine of universal jurisdiction for grave human rights crimes.

byline.original: By RAPHAEL MINDER and MARLISE SIMONS
byline.contributor: Raphael Minder reported from Madrid, and Marlise Simons from Paris. Rick Gladstone contributed reporting from New York.

lead_paragraph: Judge Baltasar Garzón was found to have overstepped his authority in a wiretapping case and ordered suspended from the courts for 11 years.

headline.seo: Baltasar Garzón, Prominent Rights Judge, Convicted in Spain
headline.main: Prominent Rights Judge Is Convicted in Spain
headline.print_headline: Spain’s High Court Suspends Prominent and Divisive Rights Judge for 11 Years

keywords.value: Wiretapping and Other Eavesdropping Devices and Methods
keywords.name: subject
